page.title: 16NORTH FARM, EDGEWORTH.
page.content: This is a{farm}of 670 acres on the high Cotswold brash it has some traditional stone buildings.One is listed and there are some new machinery and cattle sheds,built of tubular steel with asbestos cladding.The farmer grows{176 acres of {grain,}mostly leys which are for slape,feed to Hereford and Friesian {cattle}in the winter, 20 animals are sold off every 5 weeks to slaughter house,in Hereford. The farm keeps a small suckler herd.About{450 acres of {crops}are grown,mostly barley,wheat and oil seed rape.Most crops are autum sown as they grow well.The farm has 4 workers and a farm manger all except one of these live in farm cottages. They work{40 hours a week.}There are 4 tractors and ordered a John Deere combine harvester for the 1985 harvest.
